humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report specifies that the patient is female and was diagnosed with infiltrative ductal carcinoma in the right breast. The T stage is given as 2, and there is no indication of T3 or T4. The N and M stages are both 0. Following the rules provided, since a specific T stage is given and there is no information suggesting a different stage, the T stage for this patient is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for breast cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. A T2 stage tumor is defined as a tumor that measures between 2-5 cm in its greatest dimension. According to the pathology report, the tumor is an infiltrative ductal carcinoma, and the T stage is reported as T2. The grade of the tumor (grade 3) and the fact that it was removed via radical mastectomy do not impact the T stage. The N and M stages are 0, indicating that there is no evidence of cancer in the lymph nodes or distant metastasis.
